description:
## Traffic Server

This dashboard displays key HTTP, cache, and network metrics for your Traffic Server configuration, providing a high-level overview of your Traffic Server infrastructure at a quick glance. For further reading on Traffic Server:

* [Datadog's Traffic Server integration docs](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/traffic_server/)
* [Traffic Server docs](https://docs.trafficserver.apache.org/en/latest/index.html)
* [How to configure the Stats over HTTP plugin in Traffic Server](https://docs.trafficserver.apache.org/en/latest/admin-guide/monitoring/statistics/accessing.en.html#stats-over-http)

Clone this template dashboard to make changes and add your own graph widgets.
title: Traffic Server - Overview

definition.content: This dashboard displays key HTTP, cache, and network metrics for your Traffic Server configuration, providing a high-level overview of your Traffic Server infrastructure at a quick glance

**For more information on setup and monitoring, check out the following**

- [Datadog's Traffic Server integration docs](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/traffic_server/)
- [Traffic Server docs](https://docs.trafficserver.apache.org/en/latest/index.html)
- [How to configure the Stats over HTTP plugin in Traffic Server](https://docs.trafficserver.apache.org/en/latest/admin-guide/monitoring/statistics/accessing.en.html#stats-over-http)

This represents the number of client requests serviced by Traffic Server, which consists of success, error, redirect, and IMS responses. This also includes requests which were serviced through proxied origin connections as well as from the Traffic Server cache.

definition.title: Max Time Spent in an Event Loop

definition.content:
The Traffic Server event loop executes any pending events and performs I/O operations on network connections.

The time spent in the event loop can correspond to latency as any network connection has at most one I/O operation per event loop.

These metrics represent information about event loops in the last 100s.

Traffic Server's HostDB manages both origin server name resolution and host health checks. The HostDB data highlighted here can help pinpoint if you are spending too much time resolving your origin servers’ hostnames before object revalidation or retrieval.
When cold misses are high, it can indicate that your origin servers are setting shorter expirations than the actual lifetime of the content on their responses
When revalidated cache lookups are high, it may indicate that Traffic Server is being too aggressive with its object staleness heuristics.

definition.title: Average Lookup Time Per Cold Miss
Average Time Per Revalidated Cache Lookup
